Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: cresswellLymeRegis
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (children ages 11 & 13) stayed here for 2 nights over the Easter period 2012. We had an adequate room with en-suite bathroom at the very top of the building overlooking a scruffy courtyard. There wasn't much space in the room, but it suited us for 2 nights. The location is extremely central and reasonably quiet. Strangely, we started off with 4 towels, but by the second day they cleaned the room and only left us with 1! It was too late to make a fuss and ask for more by the time we got home. The room was clean and very warm, however my big recommendation would be not to open the windows as we were all eaten alive in the night by mosquitoes. I had 50 bites alone and our poor 11 year old son's face was covered. This hotel is nothing special, but it was fairly cheap for Venice and we were out all day exploring so were not really interested in comforts.

Reviews.Title: “okay if you just want to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: SpearLord
Reviews.Content: There is nothing great about this hotel. This is a budget hotel for people that want to stay in Venice for 2-3 nights max, and know that they would come back to the hotel only to spend the night. Everything about this hotel is just average. The rooms, bathroom, bed, space in the room, furniture, television, hotel itself and breakfast. DO NOT come here with high expectations. The breakfast is clubbed with another hotel in case they have low occupancy, otherwise, you have it at the restaurant right below the hotel, and again, its just average. It has a great location though, right at the center of all the main attractions Venice has to offer. So if you want to save some extra bucks for shopping, and are only in town for a few days, this hotel is not such a bad idea.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped bathroom! We dreaded using it!”
Reviews.Author: Ysabel
Reviews.Content: We didn't know that Hotel Rio consisted of 3 properties located in 3 different buildings which are near each other when we booked our room. We only found out that the booking we made was for their 2 star property when we got to the hotel. The room we were given was located in the building behind the reception. You have to go out and turn left to get to our hotel building. Our room was decent enough but the bathroom was terrible! It was very cramped! The toilet bowl was right in front of the tiny sink and you could literally wash your hands or brush your teeth while sitting on the toilet bowl. You will not fit inside the bathroom if you are on the heavy side. The sink was so tiny that it wasn't large enough to catch the falling water while you wash your face so the floor would get wet. The shower area was so small that the shower curtain would stick to you if you squatted on the floor to wash your privates. We dreaded using the bathroom and we couldn't wait to check out because of it. The only good thing about the bathroom was that it looked like it was newly renovated so the toilet bowl, sink, shower area were still new and had no grout or unsightly streaks. FYI, instead of providing you with towels they give white sheets which have the same texture as a table cloth / table napkin. It might seem weird but it actually does its job. I guess you would be ok with this hotel if you are not fussy/particular about the bathroom and you're very low maintenance. I would not recommend this hotel to my friends. I'm sure there are better hotels within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, average”
Reviews.Author: lab51
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the small plaza which can be noisy at night, but provides for a colorful and enchanting people watching. There is a restaurant which serves run of the mill offerings of pizza et al. Lugging luggages around Venice can be a chore, with all the bridges and steps and narrow alleys, so travel light. Staff is okay, but won't go the extra mile to help for directions. There is a small room where you can store luggages before check in time.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Anna T
Reviews.Content: We first got there and the hotel reception desk was horrible but we walked up to our room and it was a remodeled one...clean and pretty comfy! nothing too amazing but it worked...p.s they dont give u towels they give u a sheet cut up as a towel for bathroom. lol

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nzgirl14
Reviews.Content: After reading a mixture of reviews about Hotel Rio we were a bit concerned but there weren't many places available and this hotel is in a very good location to see the sights so we decided to give it a go. It was easy to find from the water taxi stop and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. It appears that it may have been renovated recently. We had a double room which was clean and nicely appointed. Towels are tablecloth like but we could live with that. Our room had a window overlooking the little square in front of the hotel which was nice. One negative was that our accommodation actually included breakfast but we didn't realize until we looked at our paperwork when checking out (we had booked a lot of accommodation for our trip so hadn't remembered that). No one explained to us on check in what the deal was with breakfast, usually hotels would tell you where to go for breakfast if your room price included it.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, but I can't believe I paid *that* much...”
Reviews.Author: CAHoya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends on a weekend trip to Venice. I'll admit, I was more concerned with other parts of my trip, so I wasn't paying much attention to Venice or the accommodations. So I was kind of surprised when I arrived to discover exactly how much I was paying for this place. (For the record: we paid ~200 Euros a night for a room for 3 people.) I have no problem paying... but I guess I'd like a little more luxe for that kind of money. Our room was through an alley in a back building - my New Yorker self did not like this at all, but as the doors to the restaurant kitchens were open and bustling, at least there were other people around. The building seemed to have been slightly renovated recently - newish fake hardwood floors, and newish Ikea like furniture (closets) in the rooms. The 3-person room came with a king sized bed, and a twin. There was another twin cot folded up as a footstool, with bedding in the closet. I'm honestly not sure how you could pull out the cot and still have room to walk around, though. Bathroom facilities were small but clean. Seemed impossible to take a shower without the shower curtain hugging you. We laughed at the towels at first (they're the material of my table cloths!), but they did get the job done. As many of the other reviews noted, if you want to be near the big attractions, can't beat this location. Next time, though, I'd be willing to stay a little off the beaten path. Oh, and note to people that like to over-pack: Venice is a walking city. From the moment you get off the train/bus/plane, you will be hauling your own luggage on ferrys, over bridges, and up many stairs. I've never been so happy to have packed lightly!

Reviews.Title: “bueno viaja”
Reviews.Author: wilsonming
Reviews.Content: the night before our flight to Venezia, we were still deciding our place of stay in Venezia. Then we came across Hotel Rio, they offer a pretty decent price and a great location (2 minutes walking to Plz San Marco). After reading a mixture of reviews on Hotel Rio here, we decided to give it a go. The staff there was quite friendly and helpful, the Room i stayed in was pretty clean, with a small TV, while the room that my relatives stayed in did not have a TV. They only offer complementary breakfasts for people who check in a more costly room ( i think we had the standard). Anyways, it was a great location for you to begin your exploration to the islands of Venezia. One thing is not many hotels in Venezia offer free access to wifi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bex147
Reviews.Content: Having read some very mixed reviews about this hotel before booking we were a little wary but were pleasantly suprised. Although a fairly simple hotel the room was clean and in an excellent location for exploring Venice. It was just minutes from St Marks Square and very close to a waterbus stop. The room was very basic (no tv or tea/coffee making facility) but appears to be in the process of being updated - neither of these things really bothered us as we didn't come to Venice to watch tv! The air conditioning was brilliant and stayed on when you were out of the room (unlike a number of other hotels where the power cuts out when you remove the key) meaning that when we returned to room in the evening it was nice and cool. The staff were very pleasant and very helpful - when we arrived they had no confirmation of our booking (our fault not theirs) as the card we had used had not worked and we had not checked emails whilst we were away so hadn't realised they had tried to get in contact with us about this. Despite this they still found us a room and gave us the same online rate that we had originally been quoted. If it is a luxury hotel you are after this is not it - but if you are after a simple, clean hotel in a great location for exploring Venice at a decent price then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average room”
Reviews.Author: Tash103
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at short notice, and was pleasently surprised at the central location. Easy to find, and just around the corner from St Marks Square. The staff were quite helpful with directions and tours, and they offer a free breakfast at the cafe next door which is quite decent - cereals, bread rolls and spreads etc. A nice surprise for the price. The room was average but I guess it was a good price for what we paid considering the great location. It has a small fridge in the room, air conditioning worked well, and beds were comfortable. The only one issue I had was the bathroom smelt like urine when we arrived, so the room felt a little dirty even though it had been cleaned. We enjoyed our stay, and would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a basic cheap place to stay which is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Other than the location”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel7481
Reviews.Content: other than the location, there is nothing good about this hotel. We stayed at this hotel for one night only (thank God) Although the room was extremely small, it was awful! The mattress was as hard as a rock. The entire room had a musty mouldy smell. (when you walk into the bathroom, the mould is all there for you to see). What made it worse for me and husband was that Venice was the start of our trip, therefore we had a wonderful musty smell on our clothes for the rest of our trip. thanks a lot Hotel Rio! (by the way, we did not take our clothes out of our luggage, the musty mouldy smell was that strong). We had brought towels from home and used those for after our shower, and used towels for the bed as we were grossed out to even put our bodies and heads on the mattress. We were also told we would get 10% off dinner if we used the restaurant part of the hotel. We did go to the restaurant and did not get a 10% discount. The room we stayed at was in the back of a laneway facing a restaurant, there was a party about 20 feet away from our room, so needless to say we were up until the party ended at 3:30am (very loud, almost as if the party was in our room). Although there are many negative comments, the positive ting about this hotel is the location. Because we were in Venice for one night only, the location allowed us to get to the most nicest places in Venice in a short time. The next day we got to go sight seeing more without having to worry about rushing back on time to check out because we were so close. Regardless, I'm sure there are better places for a little more money, but at least you'll sleep in clean air and no have everything stink for the rest of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic accommodation at good price.”
Reviews.Author: Minkymoo22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the appartment, and were pleasantly surprised by the proximity to St Marks. The rooms were basic but comfortable enough. The air conditioning unit was poor. It was useful to have the kitchen area as eating out is very pricey in Venice. A real find for the price!

Reviews.Title: “very expensive for very small rooms with poor amenities, bad attitude”
Reviews.Content: The rooms where tiny, bathrooms even smaller (a shower, toilet and bidet on a phone booth sized floor), with strange bedsheet-like towels and naked light bulbs to give it a slightly ghetto feeling. Breakfast was not included for our room (read the fine print on your reservation; the website stated breakfast included but the reservation omitted it in fine print). Good location but that's all. Staff was dismissive (am being polite) of our attempts to discuss breakfast, for which we paid extra for one morning (only 7 euro) but it was lame (bread, jam, juice and fake cafe) and we had a much better breakfast at a cafe around the corner for a little more. Both hotels we had used previously were less expensive by about 40% and about 3 a minute walk further away from Piazza San Marco (both were unavailable). The neighborhood was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Average place in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: BRA_BNE
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. Was really busy so we staying in another building. It has everything you need to explore the city comfortably - 5 minutos from the piazza, although really quiet, a good bed and a private bathroom. The entrance wasn't really inviting but for the price and location, who cares? You are in Venice, you really don't want to stay in your hotel room so this option is really perfect. We paid 60 Euros for a double ensuite room, a real bargain for venice, especially when so close to the San Marco Square. I would'n think twice if back in Venice, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They lie to you and donÂ´t offer what they proimise”
Reviews.Author: Explorer5023
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice with my family last May and were very happy when we found out that the hotel was located in a very nice area. After checking in the girl who was at the front desk asked us to pick up our luggage and to follow her. We went out of the building and started walking in the street. I asked her where were we going and she told us that the hotel was fully booked and that we were going to stay in another building. We were ok with that, thinking that we would stay in a nearby bulding. The building was nos that close. You have to walk through a bridge (with unconfortable steps when you are carrying your luggage). Then we were really upset when we found out the building had no elevator and it was not a hotel. They take you to an apartment, with no TV, no telephone (so you have to walk to the hotel if you need assistance). We wonÂ´t stay there again since they were not honest when we booked. To make it worse, the girl who was at the front desk had a very rude attitude. She even told us we shouldnÂ´t complain since the apartment was bigger than a room! Very bad attitude and service. I would recommend people to try to find a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hotel in Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: David_Ashby
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise the Hotel Rio enough. Located just 2.5 mins from Saint Marks Square and 2.5 from the waterfront (we timed), its a fantastic base for exploring the city. It sits in a little square near to lots of restaurants, shops, a post office, take aways, an internet cafe and only a few minutes walk from the vaparetto stops at San Zaccaria. The hotel was a bargain. They have cheaper rooms with shared bathrooms but we stumped up for a "superior": en-suite with view of the square and breakfast included for only â‚¬5 more. For price, this hotel simply cannot be beaten. The room was simple, clean and quite spacious, with TV and minibar. Ensuite had toilet, bidet, hair dryer and the best, warmest and most powerful shower I've ever had in a hotel. We had nothing to grumble about the room (though if you had to push me, we couldn't work out how to use the digital safe in the wardrobe). Several others on here have complained that they use bedsheets for towels- Infact, although they do resemble sheets, these large thick cotton sheets I have found are commonly used as towels in homes and hotels all across Italy. Breakfast is served in the restaurant below. All the bread is made fresh every morning. Watching it being made was fascinating, and the smell divine. Breakfast was a buffet that changed slightly every day though always included things like cereal, bread, toast, jam and spreads, hams and meats, sweat cakes and biscuits and fruit salads. You also help yourself to as much tea, coffee and fruit juice as you can drink. Overall I really couldn't fault this hotel. We had a wonderful stay. The price was fantastic (a bargain for Venice), the location unbeatable and the room and breakfast great. I would like to note though, the rooms are located on the first floor of the building. Venice overall is not the most disabled friendly city and like many hotels, it has no lift, so this may make it unsuitable for those with mobility problems.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, everything else average”
Reviews.Author: clarity003
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rio had a great location for walking to and from St Marc Square or crossing the grand canal. Perfect for only having two days to explore Venice. Staff was generally helpful and explained how to get to the airport (since we didn't have WIFI, like they promised). Rooms were Spartan, and located in a small (slightly sketchy) alley apart from the hotel where construction woke us up every morning. LIKED: location, safety deposit box, cleanliness DISLIKED: noise from construction, sketchy alley, weird towels (more like thick bed sheets), NO WIFI or TV as advertised, not all lights worked in room

Reviews.Title: “... if you only need a bed.”
Reviews.Author: max7218
Reviews.Content: luckly only spent 1 night. Gave us a key and were sent to a place close by, 3rd floor without a lift, the room did not have a TV ! (did not even mention to us when booking).

Reviews.Title: “WORST MATTRESS EVER!!! SMALL ROOM!!!”
Reviews.Author: carissa525
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice at the end of Octorber, and took a quadro-room in this hotel for 2 nights. First of all, when we arrived there, we had to ring a boor bell, so a woman came to us and brought us to another building which was 3 minutes away behind the hotel, it was just an old building. Second of all, the room was very small, with one double bed and 2 single sofa beds. There was almost nowhere to stand in the room. And these 2 sofa beds were THE WORST beds I've ever seen/slept in my life. We can tell how bad they were without touching, even there were sheets on the top, but we just could see the shapes of the springs!! The bathroom was clean, the towels they provided were very very thin but seemed clean, and they didn't provide shampoo, but only shower gel. We paid 160 EUROS per night for this room, I have to say it was too much for what it was. Probably the only good thing is the location, the staff was with smiles. And we could leave our luggages after checked-out. I'm sure I wouldn't want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “so cheap with an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: abreeze61
Reviews.Content: I loved Hotel Rio. The room was small but clean, very quiet and tucked away down a side street away from a bustling square. The room didn't have WiFi or a TV (that they claimed when I booked), but as we were never in the room for more than a few hours, this didn't make much difference. The tablecloth towels were very strange, but we'd come prepared with towels after reading the reviews here. For an expensive city like Venice I think Hotel Rio is a real find. Probably not for honeymooners of luxury-lovers, but as a great base from which to explore the city (St Mark's is a five minute stroll away), I could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good address”
Reviews.Author: morfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the apartment Rio 4, which is to be found at the homepage of Hotel Tiepolo. We stayed with our 3 children for new-year for two nights at this apartment and we were really surprised by the quality of the apartment and the friendliness of the staff. Two quite big rooms, one with a double and a single bed and one with two single beds. One very nice, new bathroom and a kitchenette with a table and (only) four chairs. The only thing we missed were hooks in the bathroom for the towels. The situation is ideal: 5 minutes from St. Mark's square and one minute from Hotel Rio, in a quite lane accross a picturesque bridge . If there is "acqua alta", take your rubber boots!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MESWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to locate. Breakfast was not included in the room price. The room was clean and the towels are thin sheets, but they are large. Since Venice is sooo expensive, the real was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location short walk to St Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: Acctg_girl
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at Hotel Tiepolo opposite (I think owned by same people), helpful staff, we had a triple room, clean, breakfast included. Great distance from St Marks square only a couple of minutes walk. Would definately stay again, great price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: SarahSouth
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel before we booked and was well aware of what to expect. I am amazed people were shocked about the quality of towels. I have encountered this same standard of towels in Brugges, Amsterdam and Rome. Be aware that the hotel conisists of a desk at the bottom of the stairs as a reception and the rooms are down a dingy alley way which does look onto a restaurant. This is only a minor issue as the rooms are clean and spacious. Our en-suite bathroom was clean and adequate with good water pressure. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. I would describe the room as functional and clean. The joy of Venice is not in the hotel room but the city itself and wondering around. I do agree this is not for a romantic break rather a budget holiday with the convenience of being close to St Marks and lots of great restaurants. Restaurants in the square in front of the hotel were fine for a quick lunch or to stop for a drink or coffee. This hotel is clean and great for seeing the sights of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: nyclare
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget then look no further than this hotel. Despite access being in a dingy alleyway, shared by a restaurant (noisy), the room was clean and had a shower-room. Two flights up, the air-conditioning was poor in what was quite high temperatures. Hotel Rio appears to be split over more than one building and the one we were in stood alone without a reception, which was located 2 minutes walk away across the little square in Hotel Tiepolo - which is where a pleasant continental breakfast was served for an additional â‚¬7 pp/per morning. This place is very central - 5 mins walk to Piazza San Marco and the Canal. However wouldn't recommend for a romantic weekend / anyone with difficulty climbing / or children - the Tiepolo might be better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SMcK67
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here at hotel Rio and although room was very basic it was very comfortable. Great value for money and so close to St. Mark's square and vaporetta. Would recommend this hotel to all groups of travellers. The square was always lively with lots of characters,etc.

Reviews.Title: “Off-hand service, poor facilities - even for a 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walktravel
Reviews.Content: Staff were off-hand, almost to being rude. Breakfast was a poor quality buffet. Room was very small. The stairs were very narrow and steep, also many steps to 1st floor. No lift. Recommended restaurant turned out to be microwave dependent. Food of just-passable quality but not properly re-heated. Wine disgusting and expensive. Both hotel and restaurant were very expensive for what was offered. Summary - poor quality and poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful”
Reviews.Author: floristonhall
Reviews.Content: I've travelled extensively over the last 25 years for both business and pleasure. No experience I've ever had comes close to my family and my experience at Hotel Rio over Easter. The Rooms we had were dirty; very noisy, hot and infested with bed bugs. The bathroom didn't possess towels in their place were table cloths as towel alternatives. The rooms needed a good clean. The staff were rude and unhelpful. None of us got any sleep. To cap it all they charged us E180 a night per room. A truly awful experience. I wouldn't recommend the hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: meb999
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel upon our arrival in Venice. It was clean-ish (the shower could have been cleaner, it had lots of mildew in it). But I agree with other VERY basic. It was FREEZING in VEnice, and the heater didn't work properly in our room. I kept having to go into the bathroom and use the hair dryer to warm up!! Very basic. The breakfast which is included is lousy. I wouldn't recommend it, but it's ok for travelers on a budget.
